intro: Erythranthe grandis, commonly known as the grand leavened saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, blue-green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
